results.title: The Very best of the Young Ones
results.brief_description: The “Young Ones” launched themselves onto television with their own brand of anarchic comedy. Written by Ben Elton, Rik Mayall and Lise Mayer with Alexei Sayle, “The Young ones” stars Adrian Edmondson, Rik Mayall, Christopher Ryan and Nigel Planer. Five classic episodes are featured. A potentially explosive situation erupts when a bomb lands in the house in “Bomb.” The guys are so BORED that Vyvian cuts off his finger in “Bored.” Can the boys hold their own on University Challenge in “Bambi.” “Interesting” sees the boys throw a party. Rik’s idol Cliff Richard does not star in the “Young Ones” own version of Summer Holiday.

results.title: The Very best of Steptoe and son
results.brief_description: The world’s most famous rag and bone men in five great episodes (some black and white, some colour). In “Upstairs, downstairs, upstairs, downstairs”, Albert is upstairs, flat on his back as he has slipped a disk. Harold has been giving him the very best of care as he heals very slowly. Meanwhile Harold is doing the round by himself - until he notices the strange disappearance of all the pink licorice allsorts from downstairs. In “The Bath”, Harold invites a ‘bird’ for cocktails and arrives home to find his Dad eating pickles in the bath in the middle of the lounge room. A bit of a social stigma, to say the least. “Porn yesterday” sees Harold discover an old ‘What the butler saw’ machine on his round, he problem arises when the vicar thinks it is just the thing for the forthcoming fete. “Sceance in a wet rag and bone yard” with guest stars Patricia Routledge, finds there is spirits all around and half a bottle of it is in Albert. In “And so to bed”, Harold’s success with women hits rock bottom when the willing Marcia discovers insects in his bed. He then takes drastic action and buys a waterbed in the hope of enticing her back…

results.title: The Very best of Peter Sellers
results.creator_credit: Robert Sidaway and MCEG Virgin Vision
results.brief_description: Everyone has a favourite moment from the many films of Peter Sellers. Reacall many moments from the classic Pink Panther films, where Sellers protrays his most celebrated character - that of the incompetent Inspector Clouseau. See rare footage and Goon-like antics with Spike Milligan. All these moments and many more, captured in almost one-hour of non-stop entertainment, showing the screen’s finest clown at his most brilliant and comic best.

results.title: The Very best of Fast Forward
results.brief_description: Comedy troupes come and go, but in Australia one conglomeration has had them rolling in the aisles longer than any other. The team of Fast Forward have become an institution in this country, making a television career out of sending up TV. The brilliant talents of the writers and comedians take the mickey out of the serials, the ads, the soap operas, the video clips - the things we see day in day out on the small screen. Relive such classics as Magda Szubanski in the Sorbent ads, Marg Downeys Jana Wendt, Michelle and Ferret, the Dodgy Brothers, Victor and Sveta (the Russian Newscasters), Bobby Batista (the visually-impaired American newscaster) and Gina Riley imitating a bunch of pop musicians in well-known video clips.

results.title: The Very best of Dad's Army
results.brief_description: Popular comic English television program “Dad’s army”, which ran for nine years, is about numerous men that comprise the local division of the Home Guard in the seaside town of Walmington-on-Sea during World War 2. The men are an eccentric lot who range in age from the very young to the decidedly doddery. In each episode the group muddle their way through a different situation in their own idiosyncratic way. This tape features five classic episodes featuring the fearless fighting force otherwise known as Walmington-on-Sea’s Home Guard. “The Day the balloon went up”: Captain Mainwaring’s fearless team must bring down a stray barrage balloon, the only problem is the captain is about to take off on an aerial sightseeing tour of the English countryside. “Sons of the sea”: Captain Mainwaring has the brilliant idea of river patrol. Things don’t bode well for this new method of attack when the men find themselves drifting in the English Channel on a practice session. “The Two and a half feathers”: apart from mothballs in the pickles and rationed toad-in-the-hole, a more important dilemma arises when new recruit, Mr George Clarke, ten years retired, accuses Lance Corporal Jones of abandoning him in the desert to die when they fought together in the Sudan. “Asleep in the deep”: when a bomb falls on the local pumping station, efforts to rescue Privates Walker and Godfrey result in nearly the whole platoon being trapped with them. “The Deadly attachment”: Captain Mainwaring’s platoon comes face to face with the enemy when they are detailed to guard a captive U-boat crew.

results.title: The Verdict
results.creator_credit: Richard Zanuck, David Brown, Sidney Lumet and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A courtroom drama starring Paul Newman as Frank Galvin, an alcoholic Boston lawyer struggling to make a living. Approached to represent a comatose young woman in a medical negligence case, he uses the opportunity to redeem himself and resurrect his career. Initially willing to accept a settlement that will alleviate his financial situation and avoid a confrontation with a large law firm, he decides to go to trial and fight for justice. James Mason plays an unscrupulous lawyer, prepared to use any tactic to defend the doctor at the centre of the malpractice claim. Also Stars Charlotte Rampling and Jack Warden. Screenplay by David Mamet, based on the novel by Barry Reed.

results.title: The Venice Gondola Pageant
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, Barry Sloane and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Once a year the gondoliers of Venice compete for the honour of being the fastest gondolier. This video looks at all of the pageantry which accompanies this event as well as touring Venice itself, describing a little of its history and crafts, including the construction of the gondolas themselves, and what it is like to live there.

results.title: The Vengeance of Lagardere
results.brief_description:
Episode 6 of Series “Lagardere”.
Aurore and Flor are still held captive at the inn run by Marguerita and brother Laho. Lagardere breaks into the Escorial and steals the royal seals. He is caught by the royal guard. The penalty for such an act of theft is death. Although the king is quiet willing to be merciful, Lagardere insists on being executed in public. Only a miracle can now save him …

Credits: Producer, Robert Velin ; director, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; writers, Marcel Jullian, Jean-Pierre Decourt ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Jean Piat, Jacques Dufilho, Jean-Pierre Darras, Nadine Alari, Jacques Balutin, Claude Confortes, Marco Perrin
